intro: Thesium longicaule, commonly known as the slender thesium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its erect, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Thesium longicaule is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
